units.title: Tissue sectioning and PBS placement
units.text: The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish ﬁlled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with
units.rationale: Describes how tissue is cut and transferred to PBS for downstream processing.

units.title: Imaging organoids on Nikon spinning disc confocal
units.text:
Organoids were then imaged on a Nikon spinning disc conevery other day to organoid growth media.
The plate was placed in the tissue 30 min in the microwell plates. Organoids were then washed with PBS
units.rationale: Provides the imaging step for monitoring organoid growth.

units.title: Primary antibody staining using HTODemux
units.text:
Organoids were then resuspended in primary antibody diluted using the HTODemux function in R.
washed three times (2 h per wash at 4 °C on a rocker) in organoid wash buffer (0.1% Triton X‑100, 0.2% BSA (Miltenyi))
units.rationale: Describes the preparation of organoids for antibody staining.

units.title: Resuspension in CUBIC‑R and imaging after settling
units.text: After the final wash, organoids were resuspended in 60 μL of CUBIC‑R (TCI). After allowing organoids to settle, imaging was conducted on
units.rationale: Details clearing and imaging preparation steps.

units.title: Dissociation with enzyme mix at 10 °C and periodic mixing
units.text: Organoids were kept at 10 °C throughout dissociation for up to 60 min, and were removed every 10 min to be pipette mixed with a P1000
units.rationale: Outlines the temperature‑controlled dissociation protocol with intermittent mixing.

units.title: Antigen retrieval and washing of FFPE slides
units.text: Slides were incubated with ER1 (AR9961, Leica) at 100 °C for 20 min to retrieve antigens. Slides were washed with 1X PBS to remove excess staining reagents.
units.rationale: Provides the antigen retrieval and post‑staining wash steps for FFPE tissue.
